titles.title: A resolution recognizing the achievements of the United States Fish and Wildlife Service and the Waterfowl Population Survey.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.

calendar.text: Committee on Environment and Public Works. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

committee.name: Committee on Environment and Public Works

action.text: Committee on Environment and Public Works. Reported by Senator Inhofe without amendment and with a preamble. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 259.

vote.text: Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.

bill.summary: 10/31/2005--Passed Senate without amendment. Recognizes the achievements and contributions of, and expresses support for, the Waterfowl Population Survey Program of the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service. Encourages the Service to increase partnerships to continue growth and development of the Program.
